title: Spies given new rights to hack the public
text:

The powers expected to be clarified in the bill include: Bulk data collection GCHQ stores huge amounts of personal information, mostly about people who are not considered intelligence targets IMSI catchers These devices secretly gather mobile phone data in public places "James Bond" clause This allows the foreign secretary to authorise GCHQ or MI6 take action abroad that might otherwise be illegal Security directions to phone companies Ministers can order them "to do, or not to do, a particular thing" The bill is expected to: Say whether the home secretary or a judge can sign off surveillance warrants Determine how internet service providers and operators record their customer activity Create a regulator to oversee surveillance by the intelligence services Behind the story:
